worldmet - Accessing NOAA Global Historical Climatology Network (GHCN) meteorological observations

worldmet provides an easy way to access hourly data from the Global Historical Climatology Network (GHCNh). The GHCN contains detailed surface meteorological data from around the world.

The package outputs work very well with the openair package.

Installation

You can install the release version of worldmet from CRAN with:

install.packages("worldmet")

You can install the development version of worldmet from GitHub with:

# install.packages("pak")
pak::pak("davidcarslaw/worldmet")

Documentation

All functions in worldmet are thoroughly documented. The worldmet website contains all documentation and a change log of new features. There are also many examples of worldmet functionality the openair book, which goes into great detail about its various functions.

library(worldmet)

import_ghcn_stations(country = "FR", return = "table")
#> # A tibble: 10 × 9
#>    id      latitude longitude elevation state name  gsn_flag hcn_crn_flag wmo_id
#>    <chr>      <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl> <chr> <chr> <lgl>    <lgl>        <chr>

#>  3 FRW000…     48.1      5.05     313   AK    CHAU… NA       NA           <NA>

#>  5 FRW000…     49.0      1.22     141.  <NA>  EVRE… NA       NA           <NA>  
#>  6 FRW000…     49.2      5.68     237.  EN    ETAIN NA       NA           <NA>

import_ghcn_hourly("FRW00034048", 2021)

The {openair} toolkit

  • {openair}: Import, analyse, and visualise air quality and atmospheric composition data.

  • {worldmet}: Access world meteorological data from NOAA’s Integrated Surface Database.

  • {openairmaps}: Visualise air quality data on interactive and static maps.

  • {deweather}: Use machine learning to remove the effects of meteorology on air quality time series.
